author: Zusha Elinson
title: Proposed Bump-Stock Ban Would Be Tough to Enforce
text:
The proposed federal ban on bump stocks would require owners to hand over or destroy the devices that make semiautomatic rifles shoot like rapid-fire machine guns.
That could be a challenge. Americans own an estimated 280,000 to 520,000 bump stocks, according to the recently released proposal by the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives. The government doesn’t know who owns them and their owners aren’t enthusiastic about turning them over, despite the threat of a federal felony.
